messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Peabody MA conference
messages.msgSnippet: www.liveandlearnconference.org ... From: Sherri-Lee Pressman [mailto:sherri--lee@shaw.ca] Sent: Sunday, July 11, 2004 10:09 PM To:
messages.messageBody:
www.liveandlearnconference.org

-----Original Message-----
From: Sherri-Lee Pressman [mailto:sherri--lee@...]
Sent: Sunday, July 11, 2004 10:09 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Peabody MA conference

Hi there,



Would there be a website or some place I could get more info about speakers
and agenda for the weekend?


Thanks,



Sherri-Lee



_____

From: Ren Allen [mailto:starsuncloud@...]
Sent: Sunday, July 11, 2004 9:24 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Peabody MA conference



"I'm contemplating coming to the conference, and wanted to know if,
in previous year, others have come alone with a toddler? "

Well....I've never gone alone, but I've never had dh there either.
wink, wink.
I went with my four children, Jalen was 20 months the first year and
30 months last year. I survived, you can easily enough without older
children to worry about I'm sure.:)
It's very non-age discriminatory, it will be fun. You may miss
chunks of speeches, but just hanging out with 300+ unschoolers for a
weekend makes it MORE than worth it! Truly.
The conferences were the highlight trips of my kids lives....and
that's competing with their cousins in AK.

Ren
